stories.title: Cognitive deficits in people who have recovered from Covid-19

stories.text: Lately I am experiencing lot of WiFi issues with my Pixel 3. It silently drops my wifi connection and I end up using cellular data for a long time until I realize. When I reconnect it shows weak wifi signal but other devices don't have any issues. I am on Google Fi plan and since I am at home most the time I don't use the data plan (at least that's what I thought)
stories.title: WiFi Issues on Pixel Phone

stories.text:
With the current inflation, market being overvalued and rising real estate costs, how are you protecting (ie future-proofing) your wealth? HN is a forum with very interesting ideas, I'm very curious about how people here are looking at this problem.

- crypto?

- keep investing in stock/bonds/etc..?

- buying gold and burying it in the backyard?

- buying real estate in (currently) cold areas?

- ... ?
stories.title: Ask HN: How are you protecting your wealth?
Run your DynamoDB workloads on Google Cloud
Apple AirTags Used to Prove That Contractor Illegally Trashed People's Property
In the middle of the pandemic, she left a lucrative tech job to become a farmer
The Porsche Taycan 4S: Better than a 911? Believe it
The Queen's Gambit a Proactive Approach to Reducing IT Vendors' Contracting Risk

stories.text:
For example, to build your web-app you hire a team (backend, frontend, all-end, QA) all as a unit.

1. team could have more negotiating power vis-a-vis big-co 2. worked together on multiple gigs (hopefully), 3. fewer interpersonal issues (again hopefully) 4. know their tasks on the team from the get-go. ..many more.

why isn't this more popular?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why isn't team-based engagement more popular in tech work?
